activity.title: coronasafe/leaderboard#326
activity.text:
> 1. Would it be possible to not restart the animation when we scroll back up?
> 2. When someone wants to take a quick look over what the contributor has been up to, the animation makes it feel slow. A delay of 0.05 would be ideal maybe?



Yes, it's possible. Using the useInView feature from framer-motion, we can implement that. However, since my exams are ongoing until March 14th, I am unable to work on this right now. üòî

activity.title: coronasafe/leaderboard#305
activity.text:
Hey, @rithviknishad  @sainak 

Regarding the scrollbar functionality, instead of relying on traditional CSS methods, I propose leveraging the "tailwind-scrollbar" package. It boasts a weekly download count exceeding 100k+ across both modern and legacy browsers, making it a robust solution for our needs. Given the frequency with which we'll be implementing scrollbars across various components, using this package seems both practical and efficient.

I'm prepared to integrate this package into our workflow if you believe it aligns with our objectives. Otherwise, I'm fully capable of proceeding with the conventional methods outlined in the documentation.üöÄ

activity.title: coronasafe/leaderboard#281
activity.text:
It's functioning well on my device.

However, by incorporating a dynamic page for specific project details, such as projects/[id], we can distinctly separate the project page from the projects page. 

This way, in the future, we can modify the projects page according to our needs without affecting the specific project page. 

Integrating a dynamic page for specific project details will definitely reduce the loading time. By focusing on just one project instead of loading all the projects at once, we can optimize the performance significantly.
